macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Edges Up 0.2% to 6,858 in Wobbly Start to 2026
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 12.97 points or 0.2% to 6,858.47 on January 2, capping a holiday-shortened week after gaining over 16% in 2025. Technology stocks, particularly AI-focused firms, drove volatile trading amid broader market quietness.[1][2]

items.title: Dow Jones Climbs 0.7% to 48,382 Led by Nvidia and Caterpillar
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 319.10 points or 0.7% to 48,382.39, with Nvidia up 1.3-2.84%, Caterpillar 1.94%, and Apple 1.83%, offsetting losses in Salesforce and Visa. Gains reflect AI sector strength on the first trading day of 2026.[1][2]

items.title: Nasdaq Composite Dips Slightly to 23,235 Amid Tech Pullback
items.summary: The Nasdaq fell less than 0.1% or 6.36 points to 23,235.63, weighed down by Microsoft (-2.2%) and Tesla (-2.6%) after Tesla's second year of falling sales. Early gains erased as software contrasted with mixed sectors.[1][2]

items.title: US Stocks Kick Off 2026 Higher on AI Momentum Despite Valuations Concerns
items.summary: US indices started the year sharply higher before moderating, with Nasdaq 100 up over 1% initially and S&P 500 flat to +0.27%, approaching records as AI developments offset high valuation worries. Foreign markets like Britain and South Korea hit records.[1][2]

items.title: Tesla Shares Drop 2.6% on Second Straight Year of Declining Sales
items.summary: Tesla weighed on the Nasdaq with a 2.6% decline after reporting falling sales for the second consecutive year, highlighting challenges amid outsized influence from top tech firms like Nvidia, Microsoft, and Tesla.[2]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: BlackRock Warns Stablecoins Entering Systemic Financial Impact Phase
items.summary: BlackRock states that global capital consensus is rising and stablecoins will enter a stage of systemic financial impact. This highlights growing mainstream recognition of stablecoins' role in finance.

items.title: South Korea Crypto Market Faces Regulatory Bottlenecks with 160 Trillion Won Outflow
items.summary: South Korea's cryptocurrency market is hindered by regulations, leading to an estimated 160 trillion won outflow to overseas platforms last year. This underscores ongoing regulatory challenges in the region.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Hits $3.06T with Major Price Gains
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market cap reached $3.06T, up 0.08% in 24 hours, with BTC at $89,810 (+0.72%), ETH at $3,099 (+1.93%), XRP +6.97%, and outperformers like SAPIEN (+25%), FTT (+21%), PEPE (+20%). Meme coins like DOGE surged 9.52% amid a broader recovery.

items.title: Turkmenistan Legalizes Crypto Mining and Exchanges
items.summary: Turkmenistan has legalized cryptocurrency mining and exchanges to boost economic growth. This marks a significant regulatory development in Central Asia.

items.title: U.S. XRP Spot ETF Records $13.59M Net Inflow
items.summary: The U.S. XRP spot ETF saw a net inflow of $13.59 million in a single day. This reflects growing institutional interest in XRP amid its 6.97% price rise.

items.title: Bitmine Accumulates 544,000 ETH Staked Worth $1.7B; Stock Rises 14%
items.summary: Bitmine has staked a total of 544,000 ETH valued at $1.7 billion, while Tom Lee's stock issuance proposal drove its stock price up 14%. This indicates strong Ethereum staking activity and market optimism.

items.title: WLFI to Mobilize Reserves for USD1 Ecosystem and Meme Projects
items.summary: WLFI plans to use strategic reserves to support USD1 ecosystem development, promoting meme projects and liquidity growth. WLFI price rose 2.61% amid this announcement.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: DeepSeek Releases New AI Training Framework on New Year's Eve
items.summary: DeepSeek published a technical paper on December 31, 2025, introducing 'manifold-constrained hyper-connections,' a general framework for training AI systems at scale. The release demonstrates continued innovation momentum from Chinese AI companies.

items.title: China Confirms Over 700 Generative AI Models Cleared for Official Filing
items.summary: China's Cyberspace Administration (CAC) confirmed that over 700 generative models have now cleared official filing, demonstrating unprecedented scale of AI integration in the Chinese market.

items.title: Google Rolls Out Gemini 3 Flash Globally with Speed-First Focus
items.summary: Google's latest 'speed-first' model, Gemini 3 Flash, hit global Search and developer APIs, marking a push for near-instant AI responses.

items.title: U.S. Army Establishes New AI/ML Officer Career Path (49B Specialty)
items.summary: The U.S. Army officially created a new 49B Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Officer designation. The first selection board will meet in January 2026, with officers expected to complete reclassification by the end of fiscal year 2026.

items.title: Amazon Ring Deploys AI Facial Recognition Feature 'Familiar Faces'
items.summary: Amazon's Ring began deploying AI facial recognition to identify specific people, not just motion detection, sparking major year-end debate on biometric privacy.

items.title: AI Industry Shifts Focus to 'Agentic AI' Systems in 2026
items.summary: Major AI companies are transitioning from assistive AI chatbots to agentic AI systems that can perform actions independently, marking a significant shift in AI application development.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Love and Deepspace Tops December Gacha Revenue Charts
items.summary: Love and Deepspace led December's gacha earnings, followed by Genshin Impact, while Honkai Star Rail and Pokémon TCG Pocket declined. Genshin Impact Version Luna IV and Love and Deepspace 5.0 updates introduce new characters, stories, events, and features.

items.title: PS5 Jailbreak Discovered Using Star Wars: Racer Revenge
items.summary: Hackers found a PS5 jailbreak exploit via the PS4 version of Star Wars: Racer Revenge, causing physical copy prices to surge. CD Projekt hints at a secret Witcher 3 expansion.

items.title: Pandoland Shutdown and Granblue Fantasy Steam Launch Announced
items.summary: Pandoland will shut down in March 2026, while Granblue Fantasy launches on Steam in March. Netmarble’s Mongil Star Dive delayed to March, with new games releasing January 5–10 on PC, Switch, and consoles.

items.title: Tim Kask, TSR’s First Employee and D&D Pioneer, Passes Away at 76
items.summary: Tim Kask, TSR’s inaugural employee, Dragon Magazine editor, and creator of the Apparatus of Kwalish, died from sudden illness. He was a key figure in early D&D history.

items.title: New Emulation Handhelds Available for Pre-Order
items.summary: New devices like GAMEMT E3 Vigor, KT Pocket KTR2, and AYANEO Pocket Play are up for pre-order with varying features and prices. Free games include Total War: Three Kingdoms and Wildgate.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Waymo Autonomous Vehicles Malfunction During San Francisco Power Outage
items.summary: Google's Waymo self-driving cars experienced significant malfunctions during a San Francisco power outage that knocked out traffic lights across the city, with vehicles refusing to move and blocking intersections and other Waymos.

items.title: Wall Street Opens 2026 with Mixed Tech Performance
items.summary: The Dow Jones and S&P 500 snapped a four-day losing streak with gains led by semiconductor stocks (Nvidia, Intel up 4%) and industrials (Boeing +4.9%), while major tech stocks like Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, and Tesla declined.
